name: Rafael Dowsley
content: Rafael Baiao Dowsley - Monash University View Scopus Profile Rafael Baiao Dowsley Dr Senior Lecturer, Department of Software Systems & Cybersecurity https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7588-2410 EmailRafael.Dowsleymonashedu Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projectshttps://supervisorconnect.it.monash.edu/projects/research/privacy-preserving-machine-learning 20082025 Research activity per year Personal profile BiographyDr. Rafael Dowsley joined Monash University in 2020. He got his doctoral degree in 2016 from the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany. His research focuses on cryptography and its abundant intersections with fields such as machine learning, security, privacy and information theory. He has a keen interest on the design of cryptographic protocols to enhance privacy and some of his current investigations are into privacy-preserving machine learning, cryptocurrencies and blockchain technologies. Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all. This person’s work contributes towards the following SDG(s): Education/Academic qualificationInformatics, Doctor of Natural Sciences, Cryptography Based on Correlated Data: Foundations and PracticeAward Date: 15 Jul 2016 Collaborations and top research areas from the last five years Recent external collaboration on country/territory level.
